questions.question:
Consider the following types of vehicles:
I. Full battery electric vehicles
II. Hydrogen fuel cell vehicles
III. Fuel cell-electric hybrid vehicles
How many of the above are considered as alternative powertrain vehicles?

With reference to Unmanned Aerial Vehicles (UAVs), consider the following statements:
I. All types of UAVs can do vertical landing.
II. All types of UAVs can do automated hovering.
III. All types of UAVs can use battery only as a source of power supply.
How many of the statements given above are correct?

In the context of electric vehicle batteries, consider the following elements:
I. Cobalt
II. Graphite
III. Lithium
IV. Nickel
How many of the above usually make up battery cathodes?

Consider the following:
I. Cigarette butts
II. Eyeglass lenses
III. Car tyres
How many of them contain plastic?

Consider the following substances:
I. Ethanol
II. Nitroglycerine
III. Urea
Coal gasification technology can be used in the production of how many of them?
What is the common characteristic of the chemical substances generally known as CL-20, HMX and LLM-105, which are sometimes talked about in media?
options: These are alternatives to hydrofluorocarbon refrigerants
These are explosives in military weapons
These are high-energy fuels for cruise missiles
These are fuels for rocket propulsion

questions.question:
Consider the following statements:
I. It is expected that Majorana 1 chip will enable quantum computing.
II. Majorana 1 chip has been introduced by Amazon Web Services (AWS).
III. Deep learning is a subset of machine learning.
Which of the statements given above are correct?

With reference to monoclonal antibodies, often mentioned in news, consider the following statements:
I. They are man-made proteins.
II. They stimulate immunological function due to their ability to bind to specific antigens.
III. They are used in treating viral infections like that of Nipah virus.
Which of the statements given above are correct?

Consider the following statements:
I. No virus can survive in ocean water.
II. No virus can infect bacteria.
III. No virus can change the cellular transcriptional activity in host cells.
How many of the statements given above are correct?

Consider the following statements:
Statement I: Studies indicate that carbon dioxide emissions from cement industry account for more than 5% of global carbon emissions.
Statement II: Silica-bearing clay is mixed with limestone while manufacturing cement.
Statement III: Limestone is converted into lime during clinker production for cement manufacturing.
Which one of the following is correct in respect of the above statements?
options: Both Statement II and Statement III are correct and both of them explain Statement I
Both Statement II and Statement III are correct but only one of them explains Statement I
Only one of the Statements II and Statement III is correct and that explains Statement I
Neither Statement II nor Statement III is correct

questions.question:
GPS-Aided Geo Augmented Navigation (GAGAN) uses a system of ground stations to provide necessary augmentation. Which of the following statements is/are correct in respect of GAGAN?
I. It is designed to provide additional accuracy and integrity.
II. It will allow more uniform and high quality air traffic management.
III. It will provide benefits only in aviation but not in other modes of transportation.

Consider the following statements regarding AI Action Summit held in Grand Palais, Paris in February 2025:
I. Co-chaired with India, the event builds on the advances made at the Bletchley Park Summit held in 2023 and the Seoul Summit held in 2024.
II. Along with other countries, the US and UK also signed the declaration on inclusive and sustainable AI.
Which of the statements given above is/are correct?

Consider the following statements:
Statement I: Some rare earth elements are used in the manufacture of flat television screens and computer monitors.
Statement II: Some rare earth elements have phosphorescent properties.
Which one of the following is correct?
options: Both are correct and II explains I
Both are correct but II does not explain I

I. Axiom-4
II. SpaDeX
III. Gaganyaan

Statement-I: Giant stars live much longer than dwarf stars.
Statement-II: Compared to dwarf stars, giant stars have a greater rate of nuclear reactions.

options: Both Statement-I and Statement-II are correct and Statement-II explains Statement-I
Both Statement-I and Statement-II are correct, but Statement-II does not explain Statement-I
Statement-I is correct, but Statement-II is incorrect
Statement-I is incorrect, but Statement-II is correct

options: Collecting DNA samples from air in a habitat at one go
Understanding the genetic makeup of avian species of a habitat
Using airborne devices to collect blood samples from moving animals

options: Studying the evolutionary relationships among various species of fauna
Stimulating stem cells to transform into diverse functional tissues
Promoting clonal propagation of horticultural plants

questions.question:

2. Detection of accidental free fall of a laptop which turns off the hard drive.
3. Detection of tilt of smartphone which rotates display.

3. Biofilters increase phosphorus as a nutrient for fish in water.

2. It is fuelled by liquid propellant only.

With reference to technologies for solar power production, consider the following statements:
1. Photovoltaics convert light directly into electricity; Solar Thermal uses heat to generate electricity.
2. Photovoltaics generate AC while Solar Thermal generates DC.
3. India has manufacturing base for Solar Thermal but not for Photovoltaics.
Which of the statements given above is/are correct?

Brominated flame retardants are used in many household products. Why is there concern about their use?
1. They are highly resistant to degradation.
2. They can accumulate in humans and animals.

There is concern regarding nanoparticles used by industry because:
1. They can accumulate in environment.
2. They can enter food chains.
3. They can trigger production of free radicals.
In India, cluster bean (Guar) cultivation has assumed significance because
options: Oil from seeds is used in biodegradable plastics
Gum from seeds is used in shale gas extraction
It is a source of biodiesel

questions.question:
With reference to coalbed methane and shale gas, consider the following statements:
1. Coalbed methane is pure methane from coal seams; shale gas is a mixture of propane and butane only.
2. In India, abundant coalbed methane exists, but no shale gas has been found.
Which of the statements given above is/are correct?

In addition to fingerprint scanning, which of the following can be used in biometric identification?
1. Iris scanning
2. Retinal scanning
3. Voice recognition

Which of the following adds/add nitrogen to the soil?
1. Excretion of urea by animals
2. Burning of coal by man
3. Death of vegetation

Consider the following animals:
1. Sea cow
2. Sea horse
3. Sea lion
Which of the above is/are mammals?
Aflatoxins, which contaminate improperly stored cereal grains and oilseeds, are produced by

Which of the following diseases can be transmitted through tattooing?
1. Chikungunya
2. Hepatitis B
3. HIV/AIDS

Consider the following organisms:
1. Agaricus
2. Nostoc
3. Spirogyra
Which of the above is/are used as biofertilizers?

Which of the following statements about viruses is/are correct?
1. Viruses lack enzymes necessary for generation of energy.
2. Viruses can be cultured in any synthetic medium.
3. Viruses are transmitted only by biological vectors.

Which of the following minerals is/are required for contraction of muscles?
1. Calcium
2. Iron
3. Sodium
Fruits stored in cold chambers have longer storage life because
With reference to the four fundamental forces of nature, which one of the following statements is NOT correct?
options: Electromagnetism acts only on charged particles
Strong nuclear force holds nucleons together

questions.question:
Which of the following phenomena are optical illusions?
1. Size of the Sun at dusk
2. Colour of the Sun at dawn
3. Moon being visible at dawn
4. Twinkling of stars
5. Visibility of Pole Star

Improper disposal of e-waste releases which of the following into the environment?
1. Beryllium
2. Cadmium
3. Chromium
4. Heptachlor
5. Mercury
6. Lead
7. Plutonium

What is/are the importance(s) of discovering the Higgs boson particle?
1. Understanding why elementary particles have mass
2. Enabling teleportation of matter
3. Creating better nuclear fuels
Many transplanted seedlings do not grow because
options: Root hairs grip soil too hard
Most root hairs are lost during transplantation

questions.question:
Recombinant DNA technology allows gene transfer
1. Across different plant species
2. From animals to plants
3. From microorganisms to higher organisms

Mycorrhizal biotechnology helps plants to
1. Resist drought and increase absorptive area
2. Tolerate extreme pH
3. Resist disease infestation

Consider the following kinds of organisms:
1. Bat
2. Bee
3. Bird
Which of the above is/are pollinating agents?

If there were no phenomenon of capillarity:
1. It would be difficult to use a kerosene lamp.
2. One would not be able to use a straw to consume a soft drink.
3. Blotting paper would fail to function.
4. Big trees would not have grown on Earth.
Which of the statements given above are correct?

Graphene is frequently in the news. What is its importance?
1. It is a two-dimensional material with good electrical conductivity.
2. It is one of the thinnest yet strongest materials.
3. It is entirely made of silicon.
4. It can be used as conducting electrodes for touch screens.
Which of the statements given above are correct?

Which of the following are cited as evidence for the continued expansion of the universe?
1. Detection of microwaves in space
2. Observation of redshift phenomenon
3. Movement of asteroids
4. Supernova explosions
Electrically charged particles from space are prevented from reaching Earth's surface because
options: Moisture in upper atmosphere blocks them

questions.question:
After banning leaded petrol, which of the following remain sources of lead poisoning?
1. Smelting units
2. Pens and pencils
3. Paints
4. Hair oils and cosmetics

What is the role of ultraviolet (UV) radiation in water purification systems?
1. Kills harmful microorganisms
2. Removes undesirable odours
3. Improves clarity by sedimentation
Other than pest resistance, genetically engineered plants have been created to
Which set of elements was primarily responsible for the origin of life on Earth?

Some species of which of the following organisms are used as biopesticides?
1. Bacteria
2. Fungi
3. Flowering plants

Creation of anti-matter helps in
1. Mineral prospecting
2. Studying anti-matter galaxies
3. Understanding evolution of universe

Thorium has advantage over uranium because:
1. It is more abundant
2. Produces more energy per unit mass
3. Produces less harmful waste

Concern over rare earth metals exists because:
1. China imposed export restrictions
2. They are found only in few countries
3. They are essential for electronics

With reference to stem cells, which statements are correct?
1. They can be derived only from mammals
2. Used for drug screening
3. Used for medical therapies

Resistance to Bt brinjal in India is due to concerns about:
1. Human health
2. Biodiversity
3. Terminator seeds
4. Gene from soil fungus

Biomass gasification is sustainable because:
1. Agricultural residues can be used
2. Combustible gas contains only hydrogen and CO2
3. Gas can be used in internal combustion engines
